website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for simple weight lifting workouts, but they may not stay in place during workouts with a lot of motion.
pros: Pair of barbell collar clamps made of nylon, steel and rubber
Easy to take on and off
cons: Best for deadlifts, squats, and bench presses
They may slip if used for workouts with a lot of movement

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the ratings fool you
customer_reviews.text: I did and I returned them as soon as I got them. They are chunky and clunky,,,, so I went with a superior technology: Snap Clips. All it is is a magnetic strip that is super strong. You just Snap them onto the bar, the weights stay in place. Then you just unbend them off and presto, good to go. If you like a really fast way to take off your weights, check these out. Trust me, Snapclips are on a whole other level... Should be weightlifting product of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Grom

customer_reviews.title: They have a few of black ones of these at the gym which are a hot commodity so I figured I should buy my own in a pretty color.
customer_reviews.text: I often have trouble with the wire clamps at my gym. I have smaller hands and sometimes the gym clamps are bended or loose making it difficult to secure the plates. They have a few of black ones of these at the gym which are a hot commodity so I figured I should buy my own in a pretty color. I got pink because that way no one will think I am stealing them and I love the color. I love these! They are easy to use and fit well on all the appropriate free weights I use at the gym. Recommend for yourself or a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Roxie

customer_reviews.title: The Hulk Green color is nice and loud as it lets people at the gym ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly as described. The Hulk Green color is nice and loud as it lets people at the gym know you are serious about your lifts. Easy locking and unlocking. Gym plates do not shift and move these collars.
customer_reviews.author: Monster PG

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my spring clamps that came with my Olympic weight set decades ago. Those were OK, but for $10, I figured I'd try these. I wasn't disappointed. So much easier to put on/take off. They are very light, too. This time I bought Blue. I bought the Yellow ones earlier. Now that I have multiple collars, all my bars can be used at the same time (safely). I did a quick angle test to make sure they hold. Loaded 100 lbs on one side of my straight bar and angled my bar up about 45* from the floor, and the collar held. Didn't even budge. My bar ends aren't smooth, so I'm sure that helps.
customer_reviews.author: DNFFTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, will never need another set of clamps again.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, holds the bar very snuggly and there is no chance these are slipping, unlike some cheaper metal spring clamps. The only downside of these I can see right now is that I really have to press the black tab to get the clamp to release, but this will probably lessen as I use them session after session. Love the color(s) too!
customer_reviews.author: Tarsen1012

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: awesome buy! i bought these to bring to the gym cause my gym sucks and doesn't have any clip that holds tight on the bar. i read some reviews on other clips like these that said they didn't hold tight and they slid on the bars, so i went with these. I've been using them for about 3 weeks now and couldn't be happier. they are easy to use, the hold the bar nice and tight (well with the weight i lift, cant speak for the 4 plate and up crew) i would recommend them to everyone
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Cianci

customer_reviews.title: NOT A SECURE HOLD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two set of these type of collars. The first one's (not from this company) are great. These, however, are loose and do not have a tight fit on the bar. Even after they are snapped into place, they easily slide off the bar. Not a good feature, since they are supposed to be "locking collars." I should have asked for a replacement because they are, obviously, defective.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Worked for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I got these awhile ago and they had worked until now. I was lifting and went to set the bar down and both sides of the locks popped open! I thought I had just put the barbell down too hard on the rack, so I closed them and went at it again, and this time I set it down as gently as I could and checked the locks, and they had opened again. I'm not sure when, but they weren't holding anymore, which is a big safety issue. They did work for a few months and were way nicer than the clamps I was using before, but for the price, I expected them to work longer
customer_reviews.author: Newegg B.

customer_reviews.title: I bought a pair of yellow for easy visibility when searching for them in my home gym
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of yellow for easy visibility when searching for them in my home gym. They're made of an aluminum like material, lightweight yet rigid. They fit my olympic bar perfectly. The standards I bought, do not fit my threaded dumbbell handles easily. They go on, but with force and removing them requires shaking the loaded side down. Doing so, will undobetedly overtime tear the rubber inside the collar. Pros- on a smooth bar fit like a glove. Cons- on a threaded standard bar, they'll go on with force. I'm sure this will shorten their longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews 4 Sincere products

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!  Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this and did see some negatives, but they were mostly positive. I can only presume the positive ones were written before they went bad or by bots. I have a set of similar collars made by Rogue and now wish I’d just spent the extra money on another set of the same. These collars seemed ok after the first couple of times clamping. However, they didn’t make it through the first full workout before they lost their grip and just slid down the bar. If you don’t changing plates much, you MIGHT get 3-4 workouts before they break. I do some volume training and change plates regularly. Don’t wSte your money. These are JUNK!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: These work great.
customer_reviews.text: These work great, exactly as described. Pushing down on the black release tab can hurt your finger a little, so you want to give a slight bit of attention to how you push that tab down if you are in a hurry. I'm usually trying to move fast to keep up with my Body Beast DVD workout. But this is really no big deal in my opinion. Once you get used to the motions, they are fast to remove and even faster to put on. They hold well. I like them a lot and they are way better than the old-style squeeze springs. I like the blue.
customer_reviews.author: Thoughtful

customer_reviews.title: Stop trolling the gym for mismatching, busted collars
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to take to my local commercial gym because I got tired of doing the "collar shuffle" around the gym. These are very high quality for the price you pay. The locking tab ensures your weights can't inadvertently loosen the clamps. I also love the color, as it differentiates them from every other clamp at the gym. There isn't much more to say about these EXCEPT....if you are doing olympic lifting, these will not hold up to that type of wear and tear. That does not change my opinion of the product, nor would I expect a product in this price point to be capable of such heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Concilliator

customer_reviews.title: Replace The Generic Clamps With These
customer_reviews.text: The design is very simple and with ease of making working out more enjoyable by wasting less time. The material is a nice heavy plastic which doesn't break easily as I have dropped these multiple times on concrete and matting with not even a scratch. The "clip" to release tension when changing plates is sturdy and requires some force to open which is nice since it doesn't come loose when working out. These clamps have replaced my generic old school clamps and am very happy with these. I will purchase more as long as I keep buying more bars for my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: LavezzoD

customer_reviews.title: Good, Secure Cuff
customer_reviews.text: These cuffs fit an olympic bar perfectly, and are very secure. The locking mechanism is a bit tight right now, but im sure that will loosen with time, and it isn't much of an issue other than sometimes it requires 2 hands. I love that they come in bright colors so I can tell mine apart from the ones at the gym, and was able to get them in my favorite color. Overall very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Loosened Up After a Short Time
customer_reviews.text: These worked great the first couple of times that I used them, but then they began to loosen such that they would slide away from the plates at the slightest tip of the bar. Since then I've had to slip a piece of an old bicycle tube between the bar and the clamp and later I've needed to layers of bicycle tube. In retrospect, given that these are all plastic and there are no springs involved, it was inevitable that they would stretch out over time. I'm going back to spring clips. They're a little harder to put on, but they stay tight over time.
customer_reviews.author: J or V

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping, I actually placed 2 orders, and they were both fulfilled quickly. Love the colors. However, the collars don't "lock" as well as I had expected. As we use them for Olympic Weightlifting, bars are dropped at the completion of a lift. There have been several times where the collar popped open. The locking tab could use a larger lip, and maybe a stiffer grade plastic to solve the problem. Good buy for the price,but don't perform as well as the LockJaw Brand Collars from which they are copied.
customer_reviews.author: Randy C Long

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: These things work! They feel nice and sturdy. Better than the pictures IMO. Was able to bench 5 sets with them no problem. Will test them on squats and deadlifts tomorrow. Will definitely update if these fail on me! UPDATE: 4 months later and these are still holding strong
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Personal set
customer_reviews.text: It's nice to have your own set at the gym sometimes. Many people move the clamps around so that not ever machine has a set. Having these with means I don't waste my time searching for them. Like the fact that they're available in different colors (got orange so they don't blend in with the red and black ones in my local gym). I also engraved my name on them in case anyone asks questions. Only thing I wish was that someone would sell these with a mesh bag for carrying around, but I'll find one at some point myself.
customer_reviews.author: silverado98_nighthawk84

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Just don't waste your time with these..move along, nothing to see here unless you're going to put these on a bar that you'll never, ever touch or use. Locking mechanism is weak and shady at best - zero confidence that these will work for anything but deadlifts, and even then better off not dropping the bar. Absolutely would not use these for squats, OHPs, BPs, or any movement above the lifter's hips. All in all, cheap crap that took two weeks to get here and I feel burned. The Fake Review Squad has been active - buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: A must for leg-days
customer_reviews.text: Well-built and keep the plates in place. My previous gym had these so when I work-out at a different place I bought a pair again. The plastic and rubber feel nice and the locking mechanism works perfectly. For $10-$12, I still don’t know why people at the local 24hr fitness gyms don’t buy these for squatting or dead-lifting. Definitely it is a very affordable investment to have a safer and better exercise. Highly recommended if you are serious about your leg-days. Stay safe!
customer_reviews.author: Nhat Le

customer_reviews.title: These things are cool!
customer_reviews.text: I like these little guys, like that fact that they don't hang out far like the rabbit ears when using smaller plates for different applications! Can't sau how well they would work if you're doing crossfit and dropping 300 pounds on the ground but otherwise should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Q

customer_reviews.title: Get clamped today with these!
customer_reviews.text: Purchase, shipping and price are great so far with my limited use they function and look great too! Time and use will be the true test to see if they hold up. Nothing ever last forever so, since these are inexpensive enough and my experience so far I will not hesitate to purchase another pair just to have on hand and another colour choice wouldn't hurt either. Highly recommend purchasing these.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Fisher

customer_reviews.title: A great deal for quick release bar ends
customer_reviews.text: You would think for the price these bar ends would not hold the weight of a tilted or dropped bar loaded with weight. I tested these by taking an Olympic bar and tilting it on end with weight. These bar ends held with over 135lbs on one end of the bar. And as for staying put, go ahead and load the bar for your heaviest squat or deadlift, as long as they can grab the bar, they will hold in place. Great addition to the gym bag instead of using those twisted squeeze release most gyms have.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Costopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is not a fake rewiew nor was I compensated in any way. I ordered 3 packs of the Greententjljis Olympic clamps and I have tested how much they can hold without slipping and I have put on 350 pounds and they have not even budged, I would highly recommend these clamps over all the other brands and for about 1/3 the price of the known brands. I did my research before ordering and there is a reason that they have the highest ratings out of all the clamps on Amazon as of the time of receiving them in the mail. They work Great, Worth Every please.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Hoogland

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I get so many chicks numbers when I use these at the gym. Never mind if they're wrong or disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: SenseiJ

customer_reviews.title: Came with a broken release tab
customer_reviews.text: Shipping came with the prime 2 day, so that was fine of course. But I opened the box they came in and one of the collars had a broken release tab. Didn't even get to use them today. Not worth my time/money to try to ship back, so I'm not that worried about them because of the price. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromie Brann

customer_reviews.title: Light and Strong!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and value. These are super Light but hold heavy weights on the bar very securely. I have used them for deadlifts over 500 lbs with no issues. They’re light enough to carry in your gym bag too. The only issue would be that the release is a little tight so a child or someone with weak hands and grip may have trouble latching and unlatching. This is no issue for me though.
customer_reviews.author: david cappello

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality, easy to use, but the red isn't really red
customer_reviews.text: So far so great functionality and safety-wise, however, in reality, the red collars are more on the maroon side, not a true bright primary color red like the other red gym equipment and tool boxes in my home gym garage. Maybe the color match failed! Unfortunately I purchased 3 and opened them all before I realized. Not a big deal, but when you thoughtfully choose items to fit your home gym style, a bit disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Beth in Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold very well ... very loose fitting
customer_reviews.text: Absolute joke ... wouldn't trust these to hold the weights on a barbell. Very loose fitting. Nice concept for the product, but needs to be upgraded so that it's a tight fit and locks down with meaning.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The gym I go to have clamps provided, however, when I go to the gym during peak time, sometimes all the clamps are in use. That's when I figured to go ahead and buy my own so I can continue my workout without waiting for clamps to become available. These clamps have been perfect for me. I have been using them for two weeks or so now, and I love them. They are very easy to use and are secure. I have not been able to test them with a large amount of weight yet, but I would still recommend these to anyone that wants to carry their own clamps or for home use.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Tight and Secure
customer_reviews.text: I have two bars- a standard olympic bar and a Swiss bar. I use cast iron plates for everything. Now that I've prefaced my setup, I'll say that the clamps have held close to 500 lbs (deadlift) on my bar and did not budge. I can only attest to their quality for bench press, overhead press, squat, rows, and deadlifts. They have shown no signs of wear or weakness since I've owned them.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisC

customer_reviews.title: Not for crossfit
customer_reviews.text: New collars should be much tighter than this. I bought 2 others pairs off walmart website and they are much better than this even tho these look the same. Spend the few extra dollars and get a different brand. I can’t imagine these lasting the year. These might be ok for simply keeping the weights where they need to be, but I wouldn’t throw my bumper plates with these. They unlock way too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Hughes

customer_reviews.title: 45lb slipped at 90 degree angle on fitness gear set
customer_reviews.text: the bar is 2 inch 1/128 and a 90 degree angle saw the clamp slip down, not fast, but enough I don't think it would slip in normal use, even heavy normal use with all the weight on the bar. I got these because one of the clamps that came with it was a pain to put on and take off, these are simple and while they fit the bill, and likely will work fine, that slipping is a concern granted I would probably replace the bar before these clamps barring a catastrophic clamp failure.
customer_reviews.author: alidan

customer_reviews.title: Well priced
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of really expensive collars out there on the market and honestly, I'm not sure what the point is, of spending 2 or 3 times as much for a 'brand name' collar. These work perfectly with my Rogue bars (OH Deadlift and OH Powerlift, both bare steel.) No slippage, light enough to not effect the overall weight of the lift and good gripping power. I bought two sets and have been using them regularly for several months now with no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and secure
customer_reviews.text: These are the best. I get so tired of searching for clamps in the gym and they are usually hard to squeeze onto the bar, I had to get my own. This fits the bar perfectly and locks down without a problem. This is way better than the metal clamps. You can scoot these right up to the weight so that it is secure and won't move. The removal is very easy as well. The price point is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, great colors!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my clips for a couple of months now. I loved the price most of all, but these are super easy to use, light weight, and appear to be well made. I lift heavy, and I've had NO issues with the clamps coming undone even against heavy loads. I also love the color selection. I bought a pink pair because, well, not only is pink my favorite color, but I figured it would be easy to identify if someone were trying to "borrow" them (and accidentally walk out the gym with them ... ahem!).
customer_reviews.author: teri chadwick

customer_reviews.title: These grip tighter than others I own
customer_reviews.text: Compared to two other brands I have, these grip tighter. Especially for a plate loaded neck machine. As soon as I got the new collars I tested them on the olympic loading pin that I needed to use a double layer of card stock to make fit. Not with these- the fit was tight. I didn't even close them onto my Olympic bar for fear I would strain them- I want them to stay tight on the neck machine as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 days in the gym, around 5.5 total hours of use.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. These are probably perfectly fine for squats or bench press. However, Olympic moves or other dropping of the bar results in these jumping open. The little plastic retainer on mine gave up the ghost on day 2 and they stopped clicking shut. I may not be the intended user of this product, but I wasn't a fan. Spring clips are worlds more effective and even cheaper than this
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as they looked online no flaws, already tested them & they seem pretty durable.. everything was pre-assembled.. I was a little nervous ordering these because I had seen a few peoples picture reviews & they had recieved theirs disassembled or with missing screws.. didn't have that issue at all.. I will be ordering another set in a different color very soon!! I love these.. oh & if your wondering if the black piece in the center is rubber, it is.. which is what I was hoping before ordering because I seen a few other brands that were all plastic, the rubber definitely helps keep them in place along with the grip! (pictures were taken after using them)
customer_reviews.author: Slcxo

customer_reviews.title: Good average collars.
customer_reviews.text: These are good collar locks. My only complaint is they run a bit on the large size. I have another pair I purchased on Amazon which are great on any bar at my gym. I bought these thinking they were the same brand but a different color. They see use several times a week so I can't complain too much. Cons: I would not use them on heavy days, anything above 300#'s, as they would slip.
customer_reviews.author: Mary From The West

customer_reviews.title: Tight
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a CAP Barbell 20 in. Olympic Dumbbell Handle. I have also used metal screw clamps (provided with the handle), spring clamps, and similar-looking plastic/rubber clamps. Compared to other plastic/rubber clamps, this is a tight fit. That makes it harder to close and re-open; it's not terrible, but I'd buy more of the other kind before buying more of this. Like my other plastic/rubber clamps, this takes 1 7/8" of bar space. That's more than the 1" for a spring clamp or screw clamp; so far, I have the space to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but unfortunately muted colors
customer_reviews.text: Edit: changed to 1 star. The latch no longer works after a couple months. They should last year's, not months. Never dropped or abused. The orange isn't as bright as it looks in the photos, so it's not as cool looking. Think orange sherbet instead of Lambo orange. But they seem to function as expected, which is all that really matters. If I were to do it again, I'd get anther color. The others show a bit more bold in the photos, so that may translate to real life. Another thing that's odd is that mine aren't branded like is shown in the photos.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Works well, they look great
customer_reviews.text: If you change weights much, these are superior to the basic spring clamps that come with barbell sets. They go on and off quickly with no fuss at all. They are very good looking and seem to be secure as well, though I have not tested how strong they are. I got tired of my old school spring locks, and am happy with getting these.
customer_reviews.author: David L Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and Seasoned lifters
customer_reviews.text: These are FANTASTIC. Im newly into lifting, using the 5x5 app. I would get incredibly frustrated when I couldnt find any clamps at the gym after waiting for a Rack to open up. Finally I decided to invest in my own clamps to not worry about it anymore. These are great! Easy to use, easy to take off and at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Conklin

customer_reviews.title: Up to Expectations
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. The color is as it shows in the pictures and they hold up better than a lot of other clamps I’ve used. I’ve had mine for a few months and they’re peeling slightly, but they’re used almost every single day so I’d say that’s normal. I have smaller fingers, too, so other clamps similar to these would jam my fingers when opening them; these do not. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: remington

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical because of the cheap price. However these have been used now on 6 different olympic bars, curl bar, and my prowler without any issue. I almost had a nasty fall squatting and they didn't slide at all, which saved my back as I recovered setting the bar on supports. Looking for a 2nd or 3rd set soon!
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Ward

customer_reviews.title: Come loose fairly easily
customer_reviews.text: If you are expecting these to hold tight through all scenarios, these probably aren't the clamps for you. I find that even while deadlifting, I'll have to adjust the weights and clamps after every couple of reps. I'm not lifting 600# and dropping them from my hips. These are doing consecutive reps at relatively low weights (185-225#).
customer_reviews.author: Robert Teixeira

customer_reviews.title: They’re clips. For barbells.
customer_reviews.text: They do what they say they’ll do. They slide on and off easily and hold the weights with no issues. They’re bright and distinctive and the only reason anyone might accidentally walk off with them is because apparently everyone else in my gym bought this same kind also in blue. But no complaints here. They seem quality and they’re easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Super tight and durable
customer_reviews.text: Great quality collars, weighing 5.7oz each if anyone cares. The fitting is very secure with rubber coating on the inside sitting flush with the barbell and on the outside. In fact so secure I have a b!t#h of a time getting 1 specific one off. I love how vibrant the green is. No accidently leaving these behind. I wish I got these sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Knurlgirl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Horrible experience with these clamps. Came out of box perfect looking. Plastic snapped into pieces the very first time I clamped onto an Olympic bar. Upset now since I was so excited to use them over spring clamps. Cannot recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE THESE. EASY TO USE AND EASY TO LOCK!! The only thing we are a lil disappointment in is the actual color. In the picture they look LIME GREEN, but they are DARK GREEN, so that's a little deceiving. But it's not a big deal!! Doesn't affect the actual product and how it works which is what matters!
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, fine, easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a home gym and ended up buying another set for my deadlift station. I don't think they'll take a plate dropping on them, but neither will my toes. Worth every penny paid. First few timesyou open them they're a bit stiff but they get easier and still hold the bar just as tightly months later.
customer_reviews.author: G.Hans

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty heavy duty compared to what I was using at 24 hour fitness. They lock in very tight and don’t budge. I only lift 225 when squatting and 185 when benching. With that being said these are more heavy duty than I need, but am happy with the quality for the low price. I would recommend these to anyone doing heavier lifts at home. They work exactly as you would expect them to.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Buy, buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are 1/4 of the price of the ones you will buy at Rogue but for the average joe they do there job perfectly. We use ours for everyday CrossFit and Olympic lifting. Have had 0 issues, these are a second set we bought for our new barbell (we liked them that much). We had used the ones from rogue (much more expensive) and they are nicer quality but they are def more for people lifting bigger numbers (power lifters).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like these because they slide on and off of the bar very easily. No hassle looking like an idiot trying to slide them off when changing weights. I have had them for a few months now and they have held up well being thrown around my gym bag and the platforms. Good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for. They work.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! I’m by no means lifting heavy. I have 1-2 45lb plates on the bar when I deadlift. And if you drop the barbell the clamps move and it’s annoying. They keep hold pretty well if you nicely set the bar down. And you don’t tap too hard between reps. These are now retired to hip thrust only reps. Bought a 50$ pair. Made the investment and I’m happy with that for throwing weight around.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Gription like a Formula One tire
customer_reviews.text: Really good clamps. Ive been using them for numerous lifting sessions per week for almost a year now. They still work like new. Don't hesitate to pick up 2 or 4 of these. Suggestion - get a bright color, especially if you have a home gym. Inevitably you will drop one and it will roll "somewhere"...to the unlikeliest of places. Black is WAAAAY harder to spot than the bright colors. It may save you a few minutes and some colorful words. Much like dropping a pen at your desk...and somehow it winds up under the copier 50 feet away....
customer_reviews.author: Mike O.

customer_reviews.title: Great product looking for leg lift clamp
customer_reviews.text: Great product looking for a clamp to fit the size of this leg lift portion on the golds gym machine: Gold's Gym XRS 20 Olympic Workout Bench and Squat Rack(Bar and weights NOT Included)  Let me know once available. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: MIG C

customer_reviews.title: where were these back in the day
customer_reviews.text: How have I never know about these. I step up a home garage gym. The old school squeeze collars that came with my olympic bars just werent cutting it. These collars are so much easier to use. They go on easily and are very secure. Far superior to the old school squeeze collars.
customer_reviews.author: AmaniSofia

customer_reviews.title: They keep the weight on the bar.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: easy to use, they keep the plates on the bar. Cons: my wife had trouble opening them when brand new they cam over pretty tight. but after a few months of use they are easier to get unlocked. Overview: These are not the most robust solution and the price reflects that. I would not use for heave dead lifts as they will slip especially if your barbell loading ends are smooth. but squat bench and press I have had no issue. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cmiller707

customer_reviews.title: No more spring clamps for this girl!
customer_reviews.text: The package was delivered this evening after I got home from work and I immediately put them on my bar and got to a workout. Was a bit worried based on other reviews saying they arrived broken, but mine were intact when they arrived. Time will tell how they hold up, but so far I love them, was able to load and unload my bar so much easier than struggling with the standard clamp! Can't beat the price, either!
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell. Afraid they are going to break.
customer_reviews.text: So far they are doing their job, but they seem very fragile and it feels like the locking lever is going to break every time I clamp/un-clamp them. Time will tell...... UPDATE: A month in and they are still holding up. Even when using in cold temps in my shop (5°F).
customer_reviews.author: B.Olivas

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the plates on the bar
customer_reviews.text: They certainly do their job. I didn't expect them to be that sturdy. Since I have several bars of different weights, I will order more in the future. Because I am a lazy person, and taking them off, even though it is a breeze, and putting them back on, is a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Stringer

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought these sooner
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and save time if you're adding or removing weight regularly. I find the collars that came with my bars don't always hold that well and take longer to screw down. With these you just slide them on and clamp them down. The 2 pair I bought worked so well I will be buying more to use on all the various bars I have.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to metal clamps
customer_reviews.text: These are far easier for me to use having smaller hands (5'1" and 115 pounds), I just can't get the metal ones to work. These were the perfect alternative for me, getting them unlocked is a bit challenging but I am getting the hang of it. Great buy, super hefty plastic too, these are going to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something different.
customer_reviews.text: I was really apprehensive about getting these clamps but I’m glad I did. You don’t have to worry about screwing a bolt in and messing up your bar. Plus you don’t have the occasional ouch from pinching your fingers and hands from the spring type. They clamp down tightly and are super easy to use. I am going to be purchasing more just to add some color to my weight room. Which they have plenty to choose from. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John Peay

customer_reviews.title: Colors depicted in photos may have been doctored.
customer_reviews.text: Not a review of their function, just thought I would point out that the colors in the photos are not quite accurate. Bought two sets, one for my girlfriend and one for myself, one set of orange and the other red. The color of what I received would be classified as orange and red, respectively, they are more of a washed out pastel color than the more vibrant/saturated color I was expecting. The orange one almost has a fleshy tone to it, nearly Trump-face colored. I'm still going to use the hell out of them at the gym, and based on other reviews I've read they should perform quite nicely. If they don't, I'll update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Chase B Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this I read bad reviews but I decided to buy it anyways and give it a try. I used them the they after and it worked perfectly and still works perfectly. I used to have a hard time doing barbell squat since the weight would move but ever since I have the clamps I am very happy and very comfortable. I call them my lucky clamps. They wont break, you just have to know how to open them properly and close them as well.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: Gym equipment
customer_reviews.text: Came pretty fast, seems like good quality. I’ve used them a few times already and works great keeps weight in place. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: JayTeez

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these clamps! I don’t have to worry about anyone in the gym swiping them because, what man wants pink clamps? Once they are placed on the bar and clamped, there is no movement. Great quality and so much easier to use than the ones the gym provides.
customer_reviews.author: Jerika

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 but only used a couple Weeks and when I took them out they feel cheap, but so far there working, yes I know they’re are cheap compared to Academy Sports for $29. After I’ve used them for a month or two I may bump them To a 5 star but we’ll see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slide
customer_reviews.text: They work but could be better. If you are doing any kind of Olympic lifting and dropping weights these will start sliding and require you to reset them every time you drop weight.
customer_reviews.author: Brain

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: just like the ones from my gym. whenever I buy home gym equipment, I like to make sure that it is similar or exactly like the ones at the gym. and this is just what that is. shocked that the price was very very affordable. I thought i'd be spending a lot more to find the exact one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great clips
customer_reviews.text: I cannot stand going to the gym and not being able to find available clips for me to use. Also I do not like using metal clips (personal preference). These clips are great, colorful and at a really good price point. Highly recommend for any lifters.
customer_reviews.author: K-Dub

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: So far these clamps have worked great. The construction feels solid. They hold the weights snuggly in place and give me piece of mind when I'm lifting. They are small enough to fit in my gym bag with the rest of my gear and they never get snagged on anything in my bag even when I reach for them underneath everything. I ordered the black ones. They are a shiney plastic. I put a couple stickers and wrote on them with a silver sharpie just in case someone tries to snag them.
customer_reviews.author: SpartanGabez

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Easy to Use Good Collars
customer_reviews.text: The collars area a great value. They securely hold the weight in place and do not increase the weight on the bar. They lock rather easily. The only complaint I have is that they do not unlock as easily. If you have weak thumbs it will be very difficult for you to use the unlock lever. If the lever was another 1/2 longer, it would be a lot easier to manipulate.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Colorful and Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Needed these for the covid home gym. So far no issues using them. Lock and unlock easy and does not come off when curling.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Freak

customer_reviews.title: Easy On-Easy Off!
customer_reviews.text: These work exactly as described! Awesome product! So much better made than the ones that came with my bar (old school pressure clips). So much easier on and off. Makes changing weights for diff exercises so easy! Order a pair for my wife's set up in bonus room, and ordering a 3rd pair today for my curl bar. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Bev-n-Bill

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, slip with lots of weight
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and hold well for light lifts. However, these slip whenever I do deadlifts or cleans. I haven't had them come off the bar or unsnapped yet, but they will shift when you drop the bar. This makes them annoying to use on deadlift/clean days.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rudd

customer_reviews.title: almost too tight (though that is definitely not a bad thing). Unlike most barbell clamps they have a ...
customer_reviews.text: These things clamp on very tightly, almost too tight (though that is definitely not a bad thing). Unlike most barbell clamps they have a little locking tab so there is no way that these things will come undone during a workout. They are heavy duty, great quality, and very inexpensive. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: These work just as well as the ones in commercial gyms. I use them at home on the ends of adjustable dumbbells that use Olympic plates (yes, it is very cumbersome to use, but it definitely saved me a lot of money and space) and they work perfectly. The clamps don't budge and have held the weights in place even when I configure the dumbbells to be 80+ lbs.
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Beats the clips at the gym
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I got tired of using and finding clips when I go to the gym. Also, I don’t like the squeeze type clips because I find them difficult to put on the bar (my forearm muscles apparently do not exist). These however are so easy to use and will definitely keep the weights loaded on the bar. I bought the baby blue color and it’s true to the picture provided.
customer_reviews.author: Feliclare De Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Bargain Quality Barbell Clamps!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to use barbell clamps. I like the bright orange color. Appear to be well made and sturdy. Well worth the money for not having to look around the gym for the shared spring loaded clamps. I use these clamps 3x/week for the 4 main core lifts (deadlifts/squats/bench/press). No problems handling in excess of 350 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Correia

customer_reviews.title: These collars hold up well and are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality of these cheap barbell collars. Been using them for months now and they've held up just fine. Granted, I don't drop my barbell when I lift, so I'm unsure how these hold up if used in that way. Being able to get these in magenta was a cool bonus. Overall, I'd purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kubs

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to use clips
customer_reviews.text: I use a safety squat bar and need clips to keep the weight on as the part of the bar that holds the weight is at 95 degree angle and the weights can slide off. These clips have support 100s of reps 3 45 pound plates on each side no problem.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Can't handle heavy weight
customer_reviews.text: Extremely tight, very hard to clamp down on standard bars. One cracked while dead lifting over 500lbs. Wouldn't recommend with heavy weight. Get metal ones.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: These work great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and work great. Much better than the traditional clamps. My only complaint is that I should have gotten another color like neon yellow. The black ones blend right into the black rubber mats on my gym floor and I end up hunting for these things.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any gym!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these clamps because the metal ones that come with most barbells are junk. These plastic ones are 100x better. They are easier to put on and they hold up better. I also love the color options. I will definitely be buying more colors in ten future!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Clamps
customer_reviews.text: Good Clamps, Does what it is supposed to do. In the beginning, it was very hard to close these grips around barbell. Definitely broke several nails trying to get these on. But after months of use, they go on like butter but still stay on the barbell with the plates.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I've seen people using these at my gym. I continued using the crappy version provided at my gym, which was sometimes difficult to find. I ordered these and started using them right away. The opening and closing action are smooth and they lock securely. It is very easy to change plates when lifting, saving me time, without being frustrated. I think they're worth it and I regret I didn't by them earlier.
customer_reviews.author: GRB Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and work for my style
customer_reviews.text: I dont bang or drop the weights like crossfitters do. So i dont know if they'll stay in place. But for picking up and placing the bar down, they work. They do move just a little though, when the weight goes up. Maybe scoot 1/2 an inch.
customer_reviews.author: Aidin

customer_reviews.title: Do you even lift bro?
customer_reviews.text: Strong hold for those heavy lifts...or not! Lol I hate those metal barbell spring clamps of death! I’ve been pinched way too many times. My CrossFit box had one set that I really liked...so I needed my own to make sure I always got to use them! I got them this afternoon & took them to my workout this evening!! Loved them! They worked seamlessly & held tight! I highly recommend this for anyone who even lifts!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McCary

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic made of plastic
customer_reviews.text: Even though they’re made of plastic these seem to work very well. I don’t plan on dropping my dead lifts, but they’ve held up well so far. They’re infinitely easier than the old school metal spring style. My only complaint is that the green color isn’t as vibrant as the picture makes it appear.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Works Better for Lighter Weight Bumper Plates or Competition Plates
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband and he didn't like them because they start to slide when higher bumper plate weights are on the bar. I took them and use them for my CrossFit workouts (65lb-215lb) and the seem to work well for that weight range. I like them because they are easy to get on and off during timed WOD's when I have to increase the weight in between sets.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey Gajewski

customer_reviews.title: Great Value and works perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for deadlifts but use them on bench and squats too. Good size to them. They feel cheap but they have been holding up perfectly. I been deadlifting 405 for reps and these hold the plates tight. I've slammed the bar down alot with no issues. Solid gear for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t stay in place on barbell!
customer_reviews.text: At first they seem to work fine except for once they are clipped onto my barbell & the barbell is used in the execution of an exercise. Then they move around & the plates don’t stay in place as well as they should. Kind of defeats the purpose of them if they don’t hold the plates in place. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara V.

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Keep them in my gym bag and use them 5 days a week. Super easy to lock and holds weight really well. Love them because sometimes the ones at the gym get in the way. These stay out of the way and get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: Karyssa Opencar

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good
customer_reviews.text: initial use is as expected. i don't expect any plates to wobble off unless the clamp is given a serious beating, but it's probably a good idea with all clamps to wipe excess oil off the bar and the plates prior to use.
customer_reviews.author: billyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Stuff bar snaps
customer_reviews.text: These bar snaps are hard to open and close. The snaps feel stuck, and can be pulled open with great effort. If you are changing weight quickly, it may be a hindrance. They may be more operable in time, after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great barbell clamps
customer_reviews.text: I use the clamps to secure the plates in place and find that these clamps more than fulfill their jobs. I work in a gym that thinks that the more money spent, the better the security of the clamps in a commercial gym. Seriously? I find that these clamps more than fulfill their jobs and do it sufficiently without having to invest a ridiculous amount of money to get the job done. I actually find that these clamps do the job better because most clients seem to think that the more expensive clamps are dangerous in their snapping and locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Gonzalez

product_meta.title: Greententljs Olympic Barbell Clamps 2 inch Quick Release Pair of Locking 2" Pro Olympic Weight Bar Plate Locks Collar Clips for Workout Weightlifting Fitness Training
feature_bullets: 100% Brand New.PLEASE NOTE THE SIZE,---If you want 1 inch Standard Please search greententljs 1 inch barbell collars.
This barbell clamp fits for 2 inches Olympic size.Perfect for crossfit workouts,Olympic lifts,overhead press,deadlifts,bench press,or any other workout using 2 inches Olympic Barbell.
Material:reinforced plastic ,ABS (HIGH Quality:Nylon 662),Package Include: 2 * Barbell Clamps
Satisfaction Guaranteed: If you're unsatisfied with our 2 inch olympic barbell clamps, simply return them via Amazon's no hassle returns
Easy to use, one hand install ~ Spring powered Snap-Latch design to keep you safe.These collars are a favorite for crossfit and many other commercial gyms.
